properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 7 at 4:03AM PST until January 8 at 3:29AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County
Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County

Olympic Peninsula Region

A cold front will move through the Olympic Peninsula later today.
Another 2 to 4 inches of rain is forecast for the Olympics until
the frontal passage. This additional rain will push the Satsop
river above flood stage this morning and keep the Skokomish above
flood stage all day.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Satsop River Near Satsop
* From 5 AM Tuesday until late tonight.
* At  3:15 AM Tuesday the stage was 37.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 38.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 5 AM
Tuesday and crest near 38.3 feet around 10 AM Tuesday. The river
will fall below flood stage this evening.
* Impact...At 38.0 feet, the Satsop River will flood low pasture lands
and some roads along the river.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
